intro: Rondeletia nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaragua rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white to pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
